item.name: Arcane Mine
item.text:
Craft Check: Dexterity (Tinker's tools) Craft Components: 25 gp worth of materials typically found in a set of tinker's tools Craft Time: 1 hour Craft DC: 20
An arcane mine is an explosive devices designed to release the spell it contains when triggered by pressure or a tripwire. An arcane mine is typically buried just below the ground to conceal its presence.
Trigger: A creature that steps on an arcane mine or walks through the trip wire triggers it. The mine also triggers if it takes any damage or if a character rolls a 1 on the d20 when attempting to disable it.
Effect: The mine immediately casts the spell stored in it, centered on itself. The mine is destroyed by the spell.
Countermeasures: A successful DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) check reveals the trap-this DC increases to 20 if the trap is fully concealed. A successful DC 20 Dexterity check using thieves' tools disables the trap.
Storing Spells: The following rules apply when storing a spell in an arcane mine:
• Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 5th level into the trap by touching the trap as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the trap.
• Only evocation or necromancy spells that deal damage in an area of effect and force a target to make a saving throw can be stored in an arcane mine.
• The stored spell must have a casting time of 1 action, and the spellcaster must expend a spell slot to cast it.
• A spell contained in an arcane mine can be overwritten by a new spell only if the new spell is cast using a spell slot of a higher level than the stored spell. Otherwise, the new spell is expended without effect.
• The save DC of a spell contained in an arcane mine equals 10 plus the spellcasting ability modifier of the original spellcaster.
• Any spell stored in an arcane mine fades after 24 hours and is wasted.
Source: HeavyArms: The Ranger (Homebrew)
